# Draft:Howard J. Curtis

Howard J. Curtis (June 29th, 1857 â€“ September 24th, 1931) was a justice of the Connecticut Supreme Court from 1920 to 1927.
Born in Stratford, Connecticut.
He graduated from Yale in 1881, and was for the next year the principal of a school in Chatham, Virginia. Studying law after school hours, he entered the senior class of the Yale Law School, graduating June, 1883, with cum laude. He was admitted to the Connecticut bar June 27, 1883. The following October he entered into partnership with George W. Wheeler, his roommate in Yale...
